title: 820-2936 no data or bklt
message:
have a 820-2936 with no data. the screen under a flashlight shows really dark.  tested the l9008 & l9004 both are good. I also replaced the lvds connector.  any ideas?
Thanks 
Nate

title: 820-2936 no data or bklt
message: Is there 3V on both L9004/8? LCD plugged in of course. Check SMC_LID.

title: 820-2936 no data or bklt
message: yes 3v on both l9004/8 and a solid 3v on the smc lid.  when i turn it on the screen reacts and makes the light become hard to see through the glass. if i turn it off i can see my light very well. this is the same thing im getting with the other board i have the 820-2914.  what would make the screen turn dark to the point where my flashlight cannot show through it very well?

title: 820-2936 no data or bklt
message: Voltage on backlight bus to LCD connector?

title: 820-2936 no data or bklt
message:
im getting 3.2v PPBUS_SW_LCDBKLT_PWR_SW 12.4v 

pp3v3_sw_lcd im getting 3.4v.  is this what u wanted im not 100% sure were i should test for the backlight bus to lcd con.

title: 820-2936 no data or bklt
message: Backlight is not boosting. Read sticky on backlight repair, this has been gone over a million times now.

title: 820-2936 no data or bklt
message:
came across this board in a pile.  i went over and checked the readings here and PPBUS_SW_LCDBKLT_PWR_SW = 12.4v  this is good right? 

pp3v3_sw_lcd im getting 3.4v.

and on PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT im getting 27v and this is good also.  i am noticing you said that the backlight is not boosting but with 27v does that not mean the back light is fully boosted?  i get a faint screen light and know the backlight has turned on but not at full brightness, also i am getting no data or logo but i get a nice long dong.  could this have to do with the gmux or perhaps the graphics?  i checked the pwm and getting 3.4v

title: 820-2936 no data or bklt
message: Check all LVDS lines on diode mode.

title: 820-2936 no data or bklt
message: Looks fine. If the backlight is preset and there is just a black screen with backlight. Try another LCD assemble, inspect connector.

title: 820-2936 no data or bklt
message: i'm getting a black screen with backlight. just tried replacing the connector and tried swapping out the screen, no change.  i tested the screen on a working board and the screen is working.  there are some red points around the connector and u9701.

title: 820-2936 no data or bklt
message: Either bad connector/soldering/wrong connector or a dead PCH.
